meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Anne Hallerman Bill Johnston Jim Ryan Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #615.

div.div: Every clue was prepared by Victoria Haselton, whose ESL class she taught was in the audience.

td.p: Anne Hallerman, a nursery school teacher from Richmond, Virginia
Bill Johnston, an aerospace engineer from Rancho Palos Verdes, California
Jim Ryan, a writer from Alexandria, Virginia (whose 4-day cash winnings total $21,950)

tr.td: BIRDS
GEMS
FOREIGN SPORTS
ADVERTISING MYTHOLOGY
CHILDREN'S SONGS
(Alex: And a brief word of explanation about Children's Songs. Those are children's songs in the form of tabloid headlines.)
GET THE "POINT"

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'In Holland, if you find one of these living on your roof, expect good luck &, maybe, a bigger family')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: In Holland, if you find one of these living on your roof, expect good luck &, maybe, a bigger family

Jim
')

tr.td: Jim
Bill

tr.td: Jim
Bill
Anne
CONSERVATION
MUSEUMS
AUTOS BY THE NUMBERS
(Alex: Autos by the Numbers, by the way, is a category that has to do with all 1987 models of cars currently being sold in the United States.)
WOMEN AUTHORS
RELIGION
EUPHEMISMS
